com.cs262.sockets.server

Class ChatServer.Chat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.cs262.sockets.server.ChatServer.Chat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    ChatServer

    private static class ChatServer.Chat
extends java.lang.Thread
    When a new client is connected to the chat server, a new chat thread is spawned to service the client. This chat class is initialized by the client socket and an assigned client number. A welcome message is sent to the client to notify that the connection has been established, and to prompt the user for commands to the chat server. The chat thread then listens for incoming client commands, and services the commands accordingly. The thread is ended when the connection is broken, such as by the user closing the chat app, or network disruption.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chat

        public Chat(java.net.Socket socket,
            int clientNumber)
        Initialization of a new chat thread. Store the socket and client number internally, and log the initialization.
        Parameters:
        socket - Socket that the client is connecting from.
        clientNumber - An assigned client number to differentiate clients easily for logging/debugging purposes

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Run the chat thread. The chat thread will first store the server's input stream and client's output stream to be used for server-client communication. It then sends a welcome message to the client to notify that the connection is successful, and to prompt the user for chat commands. The thread then goes into an infinite while loop to read inputs from the client, process it accordingly by calling parseMessage. When the connection is broken, such as by the client closing the chat app or a network disruption, an exception is thrown and the thread is ended.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • parseMessage

        private void parseMessage(java.lang.String input,
                          java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Process a command sent by the client. The input message is first checked for valid headers, and split via whitespaces into a message array. The main content of the message is then processed based on the op_code of the main message. The opcode is always in the first element of the message array. If a command requires user privileges (such as sending messages or deleting account), the message must contain a cookie from the client to authenticate the user. For simplicity, the cookie is also the client username. The cookie is always stored at the last element of the message array.
        Parameters:
        input - message sent by the client
        out - Socket output stream for the client

      • checkHeaders

        private java.lang.String checkHeaders(java.lang.String msg)
        Check if the headers of the client side message is valid. There are 2 levels of checks. First, the chat app version number has to be correct. Secondly, the message length has to be correct.
        Parameters:
        msg - client-side message that will be checked.
        Returns:
        the message with the headers removed if the message header is correct. Null if there is a problem with the headers.

      • SendOverNetwork

        private void SendOverNetwork(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                             java.lang.String message)
        Pad the message with a header that does not modify the cookies and send it over the network. The header contains the app version number, an opcode that says that this server reply does not modify the cookie, and the length of the message (to be used as a checker on the client side). This function is used for commands that does not involve changing on login status, such as sending messages or listing groups.
        Parameters:
        out - Client Socket that message will sent to
        message - message that will be sent to client

      • SendOverNetworkCookie

        private void SendOverNetworkCookie(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                                   java.lang.String message,
                                   java.lang.String cookie)
        Pad the message with a header to set cookies and send it over the network. The header contains the app version number, an opcode to set the cookie followed by the cookie, and the length of the message (to be used as a checker on the client side). This function is used when the client signs in to the chat application, either via a successful ":login" or "create" command. This will set the cookie on the client side, so that the client can use this as an authentication device when performing commands that requires the user to be logged in.
        Parameters:
        out - Client Socket that message will sent to
        message - message that will be sent to client
        cookie - cookie to be set at client side

      • SendOverNetworkClearCookie

        private void SendOverNetworkClearCookie(java.io.PrintWriter out,
                                        java.lang.String message)
        Pad the message with a header to clear cookies and send it over the network. The header contains the app version number, an opcode to clear the cookie on the client side, and the length of the message (to be used as a checker on the client side). This function is only used when the client chooses to exit the chat application, either via a successful ":signout" or ":delete" command. This will clear the cookie on the client side so that the client cannot send any operations that requires login.
        Parameters:
        out - Client Socket that message will sent to
        message - message that will be sent to client

      • createAccount

        private boolean createAccount(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String password)
        Create an account with (username, password) Check if the username has been taken. If it has not been taken, add the (username, password) into the accounts table, and set the user as "ONLINE". This is because the chat server will automatically log the client in after he creates an account.
        Parameters:
        name - Username to be created
        password - password associated to the username.
        Returns:
        false if the account name has already name. True otherwise

      • sendChatMessage

        private java.lang.String sendChatMessage(java.lang.String receiver,
                                         java.lang.String message)
        Send a message to another user (receiver). A few levels of checks has to be done. Firstly, check if the receiver is a valid user by if the username exist in the accounts table. Secondly, check if the receiver is online. If the user is online, the chat server can send the message to the receiver directly. If the receiver is offline, save the message in the undeliveredMessages hash table so that the receiver can receive when he logs back in. Returns a message for the action performed back. This ultimately be sent back to the sender chat client.
        Parameters:
        receiver - user who will receive the message
        message - message to be sent to be receiver
        Returns:
        "Message Sent" if the message is successful sent (offline or online), "Recipient does not exist" if the receiver cannot be found.

      • check_credentials

        private boolean check_credentials(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String password)
        Check if the login credentials are valid. This is a 2-level check. Firstly, the username has to exist in the accounts. Secondly, the password given has to match the password in the accounts.
        Parameters:
        name - username received by chat server
        password - password associated with the username
        Returns:
        true if the username and password is correct, false otherwise

      • signout

        private void signout(java.lang.String name)
        Called when a message with opcode SIGNOUT is received by the chat server. Sign the user out of the system by setting accountstatus to offline.
        Parameters:
        name - username that will be signed out of the chat application.

      • log

        private void log(java.lang.String message)
        output the logging to screen
        Parameters:
        message - Log message that will be displayed on screen
